content: Posting #25600 for triage/next steps: This was originally posted May 16th, but someone posted 2 days ago that they encountered the same error as the initial post: KeyError: 'username'.

Quoting from Github issue...

I`m trying to import RocketChat db into fresh zulip installation on debian 11. After few minutes i get error:

./manage.py convert_rocketchat_data ~/rocketchat --output /tmp/converted_rocketchat_data
Converting Data ...
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-05-15-15-24-28/./manage.py", line 151, in <module> execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-05-15-15-24-28/./manage.py", line 116, in execute_from_command_line utility.execute()
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/f83291df01ae201856e0f1cfa44d0fe3851f1b08/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 440, in execute self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/f83291df01ae201856e0f1cfa44d0fe3851f1b08/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 402, in run_from_argv self.execute(*args, **cmd_options)
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/f83291df01ae201856e0f1cfa44d0fe3851f1b08/zulip-py3-venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 448, in execute output = self.handle(*args, **options)
File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-05-15-15-24-28/zerver/management/commands/convert_rocketchat_data.py", line 45, in handle do_convert_data(rocketchat_data_dir=data_dir, output_dir=output_dir)
File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-05-15-15-24-28/zerver/data_import/rocketchat.py", line 1065, in do_convert_data username_to_user_id_map: Dict[str, str] = map_username_to_user_id(user_id_to_user_map)
File "/home/zulip/deployments/2023-05-15-15-24-28/zerver/data_import/rocketchat.py", line 970, in map_username_to_user_id username_to_user_id_map[user_dict["username"]] = user_id KeyError: 'username'
Noting here that there was a recent discussion about a RocketChat import issue here #production help > âœ” Rocketchat import issue #25596, but not sure they are related.

I don't think that #25596 is related.

These sorts of problems are very hard to debug unless we can replicate or get the user's dump.

Since we are dealing with sort of wild data here, it might be helpful to preemptively parse them extending WildValue to get better error messages to debug problems like this. I suspect that this kind of unchecked KeyErrors inevitably happens because we can't always keep up with Rocket.Chat's data model.
Rocket.Chat's exports are a MongoDB dump, so they also can have anomalies resulting from old versions of Rocket.Chat that used a different format and didn't get migrated properly.

The WildValue idea might be helpful; I don't know how hard that would be but having an error message that reveals what's going on would help. We can also ask if the user is up for sharing their dump with someone on the team for the express purpose of debugging this.
It would be nicer to use a validating deserializer like cattrs, so that our expectations are expressed declaratively and not buried in runtime code.
